subject: RE: Simplifying testing (was OT? (Re: [junit] Testing initial conditions))
msgSnippet: Thanks, Simon. Yes, you re right... but immutable JavaBeans are better! Get rid of those damn setX() methods. They are the real evil. Oh yes... and the
messageBody:
Thanks, Simon.

Yes, you're right... but immutable JavaBeans are better! Get rid of those
damn setX() methods. They are the real evil. Oh yes... and the no-argument
constructor, too: according to the corollary to the Samurai Principle, if
you can't create the object in a valid state, don't bother.

===========================================
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services Inc.
Software development with Java and Extreme Programming
